website_summaries.verdict: A good military shovel option to buy when you want other survival tools at the same time.
pros: Long shovel handle hides various other survival tools such as a knife and fire starter
Included fabric bag contains the shovel and makes it easy to carry on hikes
Made of high carbon steel and aviation aluminum alloy
cons: Entire shovel handle cannot be connected without removing some of the accessories

customer_reviews.title: good stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Some time the dimensions don't give an accurate size of a product. I wear a glove size of XL, this shovel is slightly larger then the spread of my of fingers. The quality of the shovel is outstanding, good stainless steel, the depth gauge is etched in to the steel, not stamped. No directions for assembly came with it. Yea, it seems obvious at times, but they don't tell ya some of the accessories need to be removed for all the sections to be assembled. Over all it is good quality, including the accessories and the knurl is good for bare hands.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bteiet

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome shovel. It's not that big but it is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome shovel. It's not that big but it is sturdy. The shovel head attachment is threaded opposite than the other segments so you have to keep that in mind when you're digging but it works great. I wouldn't use the axe head for larger tree limbs or hardwood but it is great for smaller tees and limbs. Probably one of the most cost effective purchases you can make for a survival kit and it all folds up into a ridiculously small package you can wear over the shoulder, attached to your belt or stored in your dashboard. It also came with a para cord bracelet which I wasn't expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Oberon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all metal design
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all metal design, used it to shovel a garden and break up some twigs and wood sticking out. High carbon means you're gonna have to be oiling the thing to prevent rust.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly made little tool at a good price. I just wish it was bigger. The small form factor means It easily fits in a pack, but it isn't light, so the small size doesn't add a lot of value to me. I think I'll mostly leave it in the van as an emergency tool. I did some trail work one day but it just isn't big enough for regular trail work. Would love a version of it that was 30% bigger all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Van Horn

customer_reviews.title: Very small but sturdy, good value.
customer_reviews.text: It's smaller than you think, but rock solid build quality. The spade small and is bare metal so it'll need to be oiled or painted to prevent rust. The handle pieces are aluminum and have a nice grip and weight to them. The shovel is very solid once put together. All the stuff in the handle pieces is pretty decent except the compass, it only kinda works. Totally worth it for a small shovel you can pack anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: IAHphotog

customer_reviews.title: Good shovel
customer_reviews.text: I have used this multiple time since I bought it, great shovel. I only gave it a 4 star because there were no instructions with it and putting it together in the dark threw me for a loop not knowing the knife part has to be turned around, and turned back around for storage. Other than that it is sharp, and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Nunley

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: A great tool and a great price. Costs less than half of the one I was looking at. Very sturdy and well made tool. Can actually use as an axe, shovel, or hoe. Great to have in your bug out bag. :0)
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Came with everything that is says. Does everything it says but one of the twist handles bent when using as intended and the firestarter stick fell out. For the price, I would still recommend but not for hard core camping
customer_reviews.author: Kacey

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. When put together this is longer, heavier and sturdier than I expected. Seems like quality materials. Seller even left a 650 braided strap in the box as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: John M Miners

customer_reviews.title: Pack it in
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as advertised with all pieces, and was well packaged. Not top quality, ( you know that already) but product is still a lot of coolness, packed in an easy space saving pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Cuppatea13

customer_reviews.title: Add this to your list of survival gear
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping hiking or survival everything you need in one pack I highly recommend . Fast shipping . Made of heavy duty material.
customer_reviews.author: Patti b

customer_reviews.title: Bag is not as nice as product but they give you a few extras ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! Solid as a rock. Bag is not as nice as product but they give you a few extras and it's designed to be used so who cares about the cover? Use it!
customer_reviews.author: OBDEWL'L. X

customer_reviews.title: So close
customer_reviews.text: Bent when I put pressure on it. Had to hit against a tree to bend it back so I could unscrew it and put it back in its pouch. Also when it was using it the multiple sections would unswear. I did enjoy that it was light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This shovel is a good value.
customer_reviews.text: I find this shovel to be useful as a bugout addition.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Byron

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Multiple tools in one. Needs better instructions as to how to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: BruceARoot

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the first one so much I bought another to have a patching pair!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McAuley

customer_reviews.title: I was not expecting to meet such a thing
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to pay much for such a tool and chose this one from all the other competitor and I am happy to do so
customer_reviews.author: Arda aybey

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: As described as expected seems like it will work well.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Four Stars because it needs a manual chainsaw and would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. A little tricky to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sometimes a bit confusing to take apart and put back together but it’s functionality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for any situation.  I highly recommend to all.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for backpacking, hiking and camping. I used the shovel several times and performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time using it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my friend for Christmas. He tried it out for the first time yesterday, and it broke on the first swing. I am very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking!
customer_reviews.text: The shovel looks awesome! I used the shovel to try to cut down a 4 inch wide tree and the handle bent as I cut down the tree, but the blade of the shovel is super sharp. The shovel does not come with directions. But Besides all of that the shovel is great!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great Design and Price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing all metal design. When all the parts are put together it is sturdier, longer and heavier than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 13 year old grandson. He was very happy with it. That’s all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B.

product_meta.title: BACOENG 17 in 1 Folding Shovel - with Knife and Fire Starter - Perfect for Snow Shovel, Entrenching Tool, Auto Emergency Kit, Survival Axe, Camping Multitool, Tactical, Military, Self-Defense
feature_bullets: Package: The kit is packed in a well-made fabric bag with excellent stitching and velcro closure, heavy duty strap adjustable for easy carrying; The Shovel itself has its own protective cover to protect from cutting. Just the quality of the bag itself tells the user that this is a serious survival kit.

The set comes in 5 pieces: a magnesium flint rod with compass, a handle with screwdriver, a handle with a glass breaker or attack cone, a handle with multifunctional saw knife, and a shaft with shovel head, all fit nicely and securely into the carrying pouch. When assembled the shovel is nearly 29" long and spade 6.5" wide. Easy assembly with no instruction needed.

Multiple purposes shovel head: with a can or bottle opener, 2 wrench size holes, a very sharp knife blade on one side and a saw blade on the other side, and a ruler. Adjustable the angle of the spade, you can tighten down the shaft at an angle and have a hoe to use, also easy and small storage of the folding shovel.

Detachable tools: a detachable magnesium rod that can be replaced when used up, a detachable attack cone for defensive purpose or car window break, a detachable free switching screwdriver that can switch as a cross screwdriver at one end and a straight one on the other end, to cope with mechanical emergency situation.
Built of quality material of high carbon steel and aviation aluminum alloy, durable and light weight.
